article: For Senior 3 students, choosing which college to attend can be the most exciting and thrilling time in their entire school lives. This is also true for an American girl _ Melanie. Melanie's dad, James Porter, who is the chief of police for a Chicago suburb, wants Melanie to _ nearby Northwestern University, where she's _ been accepted. But Melanie, 17,really wants to go to Georgetown University in Washington, D.C, where she's been wait-listed. When she gets an unexpected _ from Georgetown University, she decides to _ a road trip with a few _ female friends. Melanie believes it is her first step _ adulthood. But despite the fact that this trip is "girls only", James isn't _ with the prospect of his little princess _ the world without him. He wants to protect her, so he joins the girls and hopes he can convince Melanie to go to Northwestern. _ Melanie's father only has the best of _ , his presence leads to an endless series of comic encounters . After following their faulty device _ into the backwoods , James and Melanie _ Melanie's little brother and his pet pig have been hiding in the spare compartment . What should be a simple change certainly the expensive car rolling down a mountain, forcing them to hike to a nearby hotel... All these disasters add spice to their trip while along the way a father and a daughter _ get the chance to really talk to each other. All parents, _ they have college students or not, can relate to the bittersweet realization that their kids are growing up. _ what Melanie and James have done, we all can find the delicate balance between staying connected and letting go.
